metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000122 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The UNIX IPC layer in WebKit, including WebKitGTK+ prior to 2.16.3, does not properly validate certain message metadata, allowing a compromised secondary process to cause a denial of service (release assertion) of the UI process. This vulnerability does not affect Apple products.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000122` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.17.92-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.17.92-1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-5.0 - 2.17.92-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.17.92-1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.17.92-1
gir1.2-webkit2-5.0 - 2.17.92-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.17.92-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.17.92-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.17.92-1
libjavascriptcoregtk-5.0-0 - 2.17.92-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.17.92-1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.17.92-1
libwebkit2gtk-5.0-0 - 2.17.92-1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.17.92-1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.17.92-1').
